results.title: Pity me not = Without each other
results.creator_credit: Saul Swimmer, Allen Klein, III Task Pictures and PMN Productions
results.brief_description: A drama about circus life and those who are a part of the circus family - in particular, a young trapeze artist played by Tony Anthony. Cast also includes Brud Talbot, Anne Hegira, Michael Dunn, Bob White, Barbara Biggart, Ann Harris. Music composed and conducted by Dimitri Tiomkin.

results.title: Pitjiri: the snake that will not sink
results.creator_credit: Karen Hughes and Trikon Film Corporation
results.brief_description: In 1936 on a remote outpost in the Northern Territory, nine aboriginal elders appeared before Ruth Heathcock, a young white nurse who they believed was a member of their tribe before the Dreaming. What she later experienced in her healing work is the subject of this extraordinary documentary. A multi-award winning production.
results.title_for_label: Pitjiri: the snake that will not sink
results.description: In 1936 on a remote outpost in the Northern Territory, nine aboriginal elders appeared before Ruth Heathcock, a young white nurse who they believed was a member of their tribe before the Dreaming. What she later experienced in her healing work is the subject of this extraordinary documentary. A multi-award winning production.

results.title: Listen up my cherubs!
results.creator_credit: Karen Milward, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Energetic and intelligent, Karen Milward is constantly engaged with life. Often on the road for her work in the Aboriginal community, her children wonder what it is she actually does. This story is by way of explanation and gives insight into the life of an amazing community worker and consultant.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karen Milward, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Energetic and intelligent, Karen Milward is constantly engaged with life. results.title: I love my family
results.creator_credit: Amy Dowd, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Amy Dowd has grown up in a big family but she wouldn’t have it any other way. She introduces us to them all, serving as a loving tribute and memoir for generations to come.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Amy Dowd, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Pitcha this : just our mob from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit: Karen Milward, Norman Terrick, Linda Kennedy-Baxter, Emily Yarram, Daphne Yarram, Bindie Jack, Bess Yarram, Ben Yarram, Barbara Tilley, Amy Dowd, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Ten members of the Gippsland Indigenous community share their stories. The stories, while biographical in form, are mostly centred on the theme of family, of belonging in a community and how both these things contribute to a sense of identity.
results.title_for_label: Pitcha this : just our mob from Gippsland : Digital Storytelling project
results.creator_credit_for_label: Karen Milward, Norman Terrick, Linda Kennedy-Baxter, Emily Yarram, Daphne Yarram, Bindie Jack, Bess Yarram, Ben Yarram, Barbara Tilley, Amy Dowd, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: Why do they call me Rambo?
results.creator_credit: Bindie Jack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Nicknamed ‘Rambo’ by his friends and named after his grandfather, a great fighter, Bindie Jack’s dad had hoped that Jack would follow in his pop’s footsteps. Jack has found an interest in fighting, just not exactly as his dad had intended.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bindie Jack, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Nicknamed ‘Rambo’ by his friends and named after his grandfather, a great fighter, Bindie Jack’s dad had hoped that Jack would follow in his pop’s footsteps. Jack has found an interest in fighting, just not exactly as his dad had intended.

results.title: When does work end?
results.creator_credit: Daphne Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Daphne Yarram gives a candid account of her life, helping the abused, poor and unfortunate in her community, trying to make things better for her mob. Despite feeling satisfaction helping her community, Yarram also feels lonely and tired at times.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Daphne Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My people
results.creator_credit: Linda Kennedy-Baxter, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Linda Kennedy-Baxter talks about her life through the people who have made it special, her family. Her family comes first and have taught her that its the little things that matter.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Linda Kennedy-Baxter, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My life with Noel
results.creator_credit: Bess Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Bess Yarram shares the things closest to her heart. After meeting her husband in bording school, he joined the army and, from then on, the family moved with him. There was always room for one more foster child in this family but Yarram wouldn’t have been able to cope if it wasn’t for the support of the older women, the mothers and aunts that provided support and guidance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bess Yarram, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.description: Bess Yarram shares the things closest to her heart. After meeting her husband in bording school, he joined the army and, from then on, the family moved with him.
